review: This is an excellent purchase for my household.  We are now streaming videos and other information routinely.  We had some problems in the beginning but that turned out to be issues with my modem and not problems with Chromecast.  I was able to work with the Chromecast technical help to resolve the issue fairly quickly.  I would recommend this product to anyone who has a TV with HDMI and USB input but does not have a built-in wireless system. This is so much smaller and less costly than an Xbox or even a Roku or others like that.  This product was the answer to the product I was looking for over two years.  Thanks Google.  Good job.Ed Vernon, New Mexico

author: DeKay "Gadget Buff"

review: I was going to order this on Amazon but then found it was available at a local retailer, so I went and bought it there since I wanted to see what it was about rather quickly. Set up was easy, plugged into TV's HDMI port, synced with wireless network, and was able to cast youtube content directly from Samsung tablet and Android phone using Chromecast App (available in Google Play store). Then downloaded the Chromecast extension to Toshiba laptop (Windows 7), with Chrome browser (the only way you can cast content from a laptop), proceeded to cast content from within the browser using the extension.  RESULTS: NOT SO HOT.Granted, the extension is in a beta process, when it does work it is okay, you can go full screen, decent pic, but when it lags, forget it. Options to "tweak", setting the pic to "TV standard" rather then HD standard, help a little, but there is a LOT of buffering and lag between audio and video. If the developers can step it up and improve upon the extension component of this product the potential is awesome. So if you are looking for a consistent and stable way to actually surf the net on your TV via computer--this is not it, yet.  If you are looking to be able to stream some video content via Hulu, Youtube, etc. via an App--then for the price, this will probably be okay vs. spending money on another type of pricier streaming device.
